reason: Les lieux, véhicules, équipements, matériaux et ustensiles servant à la préparation au conditionnement, à l'entreposage, au transport, à l'étiquetage et au service des produits, ainsi que les autres installations et locaux sanitaires, doivent être propres.

reviews.text:
(change of ownership some months ago)

review for previous ownership: their bun bo hue was probably the best I had outside of home. was only available on Friday so it was mark on my calendar when I was feeling bun bo hue.

the pho was quite good, almost up to par with the best ones.

mind you, I haven't went in some months and since then, learned that they change owner and chefs so take this with a grain of salt as I have no idea how the current management is. I rarely eat out for vietnamese food
Excellent beef spring rolls. Tonkinoise soup  also amazing. Very good and affordable comfort food.
Food is adequate and cheap but come on! No friendly service whatsoever. No smile! Nothing! Montreal food customer services seriously need some attention 👎☹️

The Vietnamese food here was below par and very westernized with their pho soup bring overly seasoned with cinnamon and their Hu tieu being underseasoned and bland. The food is very obviously catered to an audience unfamiliar with traditional Vietnamese food so I will not hold that against the restaurant however the service was appalling with myself as well as other tables being left unattended while the servers sat and played on their phones. Only the store owner would bring us water, serve us food, or get other tables what they needed such as a bottle opener.

Large menu with endless options. Amazing food at a completely affordable price. Very friendly staff. We purposely ordered more than we could eat just so we could go home with leftovers. Another Montreal local gem. Best wonton soup ever! Also the fried deserts are to die for.

Tout produit conditionné en vue de la vente doit porter, en caractères indélébiles, très lisibles et apparents, sur le récipient, l'emballage ou l'enveloppe qui le contient les inscriptions nécessaires pour révéler la nature, l'état, la composition, l'utilisation, la quantité exacte, l'origine et toute particularité du produit; les nom et adresse du fabricant, préparateur, conditionneur, emballeur, fournisseur ou distributeur; le lieu de fabrication, préparation ou conditionnement du produit. L'énumération des composants doit figurer par ordre d'importance décroissant. L'indication de poids doit tenir compte de la perte que peut normalement subir le produit après son conditionnement et être exprimée en poids net.

reviews.text: Great portions and atmosphere. One plate of dumplings is more than enough for one person. Fortunately you can pay a bit extra to mix two types of fillings.
The dumplings are delicious. We tried 4 types and all of them were delicious. My suggestion is don't get fried as the steamed are so much tastier

WORST SERVICE EVER ! If i could rate less I would do ! We got there today for a "quick afternoon snack ", said "hello" twice with no answer, got plates and chopsticks thrown on the table same with the water because it was the waitress's break time. She didn't even pay attention at us at all. The dumplings were not as good as usual with holes everywhere and almost empty.We don't expect the best service when we go to this kind of place but I think you can at least be polite. We felt very bad and wanted to leave quickly. I just got a smile when it was time to pay.

Very good place andmy favorite for dumpling eating.. I don't recommend people to visit at peak hours since the quality of the service might decrease and the waiting time can be more than 40 minutes... Aside from that the food is really good.

I've been to this place 2 times and the first time was ok , I'm a bit disappointed in how I let myself get fooled a second time. I'll elaborate a bit on my 2nd time experience. The waitresses don't speak English nor French and their extremely rude. Our waitress was also extremely unhygienic ( very bad breath) and came to us 3 times within our first minute of being seated to ask us what our order was. After telling her we needed at least a few minutes to take a look at the menu she seemed annoyed and I had a feeling she wasn't going to come back so I set a timer just out of curiosity. 25 minutes later she came back and asked us our order. The food came out at a decent pace . We still left a 15% tip but were dying inside. This place feels unhygienic and just not the kind of place I'd waste any more money on . One of my rule of thumb is , you can always judge a restaurant by the cleanliness of its bathroom , I won't go into details of how these ones were but I'm sure you guys can imagine. 0/5 if it was possible.

reviews.text: I discovered this place 3 years ago and never looked back! This place is amazing! You def need reservations in advance, and I wish they would expand to be bigger. Overall its excellent food, hands down! Service and staff is great, and very reasonably priced!
Great portuguese chicken at a reasonable price.
Great food and amazing service. Thank you guys.
The chicken was bland nothing portugese about it. The service is lousy.The coffee tasted like dishwater. And the cup was half full. The prices are ok.but you don't get what you paid for.

Great portuguese restaurant with the traditional roasted chicken, cod dishes, pastel de nata and good portuguese wine selection. On weekends you should call and make a reservation, the place is small and usually packed. My favorite portuguese restaurant in Montreal by far.

reviews.text: This is a cautionary tale so read carefully: I started buying half-chicken take-out at Sabra a few months ago and I found that the food was great and that the service was respectable. Most workers there are great human beings, and I still believe this with my heart to this very day. But all of this changed once I've had the misfortune of being patronized by an older gentleman with glasses. (I assume he is the owner.) Knowing that the price is 12$ (taxes incl.) the gentleman with glasses handed me back $7.50 when I gave him a $20, effectively charging me $12.50. At first I didn't think much of it, assuming that the price had gone up. Then on a different occasion that same week, a different clerk charged me $12. That's when it registered that perhaps the older guy with glasses was doing this deliberately. Anyhow, on a separate week my wife had gone to the shop and ordered a half-chicken platter and was charged $12. That night I went to the restaurant on my own and there was the older guy with glasses. I ordered the same thing that my wife had ordered earlier that day and guess how much I was charged? $12.75. I didn't say anything because I didn't want to cause a scene over $0.75, but I made a mental note to myself that this is no longer a mistake and that it was a deliberate attempt on the guy's behalf to play me for a fool, which is insulting and not acceptable. There is absolutely no reason why I should be charged  more than other customers for the exact same thing. You will never have my business again, and I will make sure that everyone in my circle and community knows this as well.
Good meat quality and good service

I called to place an order over 75$ (according to just eat) but I wanted to be explained what the shish taouk came with and what the kilo meant before I ordered a couple of them. I know stupid me not knowing what something is and wanting to know what I'm going to be spending my money on much less what is going into my body. After a very rude conversation where I was told he doesn't speak English and getting hung up on, I called back. Was hung up on 3 times. By the 4th time I called the guy could speak english. And insisted that I speak French. Now I just moved to montreal less than 7 days ago and have been trying to do most of my interactions I french. But excuse me for not being proficient enough yet in my french to convey how disgusted I am by your attitude. Keep up the attitude and no amount of positive review will allow you to keep your store open. Just pathetic.
You never tasted a kefta or shish taouk unless you've been there. Their homemade merguez are to die for.
Good and fresh quality

reviews.text: Very nice place for a different all you can eat, it's not a walking buffet. You order what you want from the comfort of your seat using a tablet and the order will be sent automatically to the kitchen. Just one thing to mention DON'T ORDER TOO MUCH cause you will be charged for left overs. I love the concept. Enjoy the buffet.

Almost as nice as Crystal Sushi, and that makes sense, since both of those are owned by the same owner. Nice selection, you order on tablets, great food, plenty of parking.

It could do with better service, though.
Food is okay. Service is great. Quality should be improved. Ambiance is good.
One of my favourite all you can eat sushi place, there is a variety of choices

I’m giving 2 stars because of the fact that it is an all you can eat place and I like the idea of ordering via ipad. However there are many issues with this place: 

1) servers aren’t friendly at all and will stare you down for not giving a good enough tip AND will ask for a tip. 

- as someone who has been a server before, asking for a tip is ridiculous. 

2) the food isn’t the same as shown on the iPad. 

- The portions come in odd sizes, my sushi was maybe the size of a quarter but my sweet potato tempura (one piece) was large then my hand. 

3) the food isn’t good quality. 

- you’re most likely thinking “why would an all you can eat place be good quality?”, well for 35$ I expected the food to not give me food poisoning and to actually taste good. 

4) Fruit flies. 

- I know how hard it is to get rid of fruit flies but let me tell you, having them hover around everything they set down is highly unappealing. 

Overall, it’s a good place to eat depending on what you get- avoiding the sashimi. Though be ready for not so friendly servers who ask you for a tip and for bugs to invade your space.

reviews.text: Food is ok. The ambiance and staff is very nice. I recommend for a drink but go eat somewhere else
Nice palace.  Becomes a lounge during the night, food is still served till around 11 I think.  Good service

Group of 4. Experienced raw chicken, mayonnaise in packets and microwaved prime rib. We were blinded by what appeared to be an upscale restaurant. Diners beware. Looks can be deceiving. Offered a free dessert and coffee due to the raw chicken. Waiter was quick and on the ball. 

Classic mojito was great. 
White sangria tasted extremely bitter. Left untouched by 4 people. (15 dollar drink) 

Keep walking.
Food is fine, atmosphere can be fun at happy hour, but I wouldn't say its spectacular.
The filet mignon burger was really good, the sweet potato fries not so much. The service is ok, but don't go is you're in a rush.

reviews.text: One of the best brunches I've had in years. The crepes soufflee was a delicious surprise of sweet, tart and sour... The service was impeccable, which was impressive given how busy the restaurant was on this sunny day. Well worth a day trip from Ottawa to Montreal...

I went to the restaurant last week.

We ordered two beers and some nachos. We got our drinks. It took 30-40 mins to get our nachos. The service was horrendous. The nachos were a complete mess and very oily, they dumped everything in it. I specially told the waitress to just put the nachos and the rest of ingredients on the side.

1) There was no water in beginning.
2) The waitress only came once to see how everything was going.

By having our drinks, they made us wait 30-40 mins for the nachos so we would have to order a second round of drinks.

It was a bad experience

This was the 3rd time I've been to this place. The first 2 times the food and service was great, I'd give it 5 ⭐️. This time however I'd give it a 3 ⭐️.  The menu changed, and I ordered chicken and it was deep fried so badly that the coating on the chicken was flaking off and the chicken was way over cooked and very hard. I ate one little bite and sent it back and they never said anything till after I paid for it when I brought it up again and all was said is that he would let the chef know. So I paid for food I didn't eat that to me was not eatable to enjoy it. This will be my last time going back.

We ate a Pourv Poutine: after 2 hours we was throwing up like as there wasn't tomorrow. Horrible night and week after. We asked 1 glass of gin, and the waitress comes with a pitcher.. we corrected her saying that  we only asked for a single glass; when she comes back she bring us 2 gin glasses; I can understand that everybody makes mistakes, but in this case, I had the awkward feeling that they pressed us to consume more. And later, the poutine revenge. To avoid.

A mainly gin and tonic bar with a huge variety of drinks including great house specials. Expect to pay $10-$15 for a good drink. They also have a special of the month. Food is great but definitely on the expensive side.

reviews.text: A bit expensive and small, but you should find everything you need. Staff is kind and efficient.

The only good thing about this shop is that it's the only option around metro station. They sell expired food (like very expired - yesterday bought corn cans which expired last year). So always check the expiration date, even on the cans.

I have been to many Metro stores in GTA region and they are far better than this one. Though, it's location is an advantage, right next to the Jean-Talon Metro station, but somehow, my observation is that even the prices are higher than the Metro stores in Toronto / GTA region.

Just no. Meat is sometimes already expired the day you buy it, it's happened multiple times on pork & chicken packaged the same day... Bad selection of vegetables and once or twice vegetables have been bad/inedible the day of purchase, ie. spent 4$ for 4 potatoes that were soft and rotted inside. Better off going to Jean Talon Market or the IGA on Saint-Hubert!
Smart place,  but on my way to home, so it's very convenient.

However, the space is really small and we took a combo for 6 people, we were five and we ate enough, not too much. If we would have been 6, it wouldn't have been enough. No one speaks french though. But it was really good.

I don't understand these guys. I was in this restaurant last year in summer the guy did not speak a work of French with customers.I went again this week same guy could not even greet the French speaking customers in French.  It's a tradition to eat Indian and Pakistani food with pickles. they had none. Too much salt in the sauce. The rest was okay. The service was very fast, = frozen ready to eat reheated in microwave ?? reviews.text: Very delicious pizzas. Great variety. No debit or credit cards accepted. CASH ONLY.
Very good products ! Just great quality, and amazing taste !
Excellent one of the best in canada.

one hell of a hidden gem. tucked away in villeray, chez apo lahmadjoune (the whole business name) is a mom & pop armenian bakery where pretty much everything is made on sight.

they are most known for their lahmadjoun which is an armenian pizza-ish and it is incredibly delicious. not only that, its extremely inexpensive. half a dozen will run you about $8 or so.

the only bum for me is cold lahmadjoun. they are not as tasty. if you happen to pass by when they are popping them out from their wood oven, you are in for a treat. if they've been sitting there like by end of day, better heat them up in the oven before devouring them.

they also have some pastries as well as pizza (spinach if i remember right) to go.

to sum up, crazy mom & pop hidden gem worth going to. pronto!

reviews.text: Very nice place for a different all you can eat, it's not a walking buffet. You order what you want from the comfort of your seat using a tablet and the order will be sent automatically to the kitchen. Just one thing to mention DON'T ORDER TOO MUCH cause you will be charged for left overs. I love the concept. Enjoy the buffet.

Almost as nice as Crystal Sushi, and that makes sense, since both of those are owned by the same owner. Nice selection, you order on tablets, great food, plenty of parking.

It could do with better service, though.
Food is okay. Service is great. Quality should be improved. Ambiance is good.
One of my favourite all you can eat sushi place, there is a variety of choices

I’m giving 2 stars because of the fact that it is an all you can eat place and I like the idea of ordering via ipad. However there are many issues with this place: 

1) servers aren’t friendly at all and will stare you down for not giving a good enough tip AND will ask for a tip. 

- as someone who has been a server before, asking for a tip is ridiculous. 

2) the food isn’t the same as shown on the iPad. 

- The portions come in odd sizes, my sushi was maybe the size of a quarter but my sweet potato tempura (one piece) was large then my hand. 

3) the food isn’t good quality. 

- you’re most likely thinking “why would an all you can eat place be good quality?”, well for 35$ I expected the food to not give me food poisoning and to actually taste good. 

4) Fruit flies. 

- I know how hard it is to get rid of fruit flies but let me tell you, having them hover around everything they set down is highly unappealing. 

Overall, it’s a good place to eat depending on what you get- avoiding the sashimi. Though be ready for not so friendly servers who ask you for a tip and for bugs to invade your space.

reviews.text: Did my high school graduation there 20 years ago! The place is nice with many restaurants to choose from. You can skate to the beat of the music then eat yo regain your energy! Unless you don't mind paying for parking,  I suggest you to take public transportation to get there
Nice area to sit and relax, fast wifi, real skating rink will skate rental to have some fun

You'll find within the Atrium an indoor skating ring that is available all year round. Around this indoor skating ring, you'll find a food court where folks can eat and watch people skate. In turn, you can opt to skate and watch people eat.

People watching people.

Exciting.

The skating ring is small and can get pretty busy during the weekends, my experience over the weekend confirmed that with many people trying to skate and falling all over the place. This can be somewhat dangerous so smaller children as well as to adults as most people don't skate with a helmet.

The staff have events on the weekend for small children as well as events during the night for dating if that's something you're interested in. They regularly clean up the ice, the ice quality was decent.

My main issue is how expensive it is, the admission costs and skate rentals can make it a pricey activity for a family. Furthermore, paying for a locker is a stupid practice. Where did you expect me to leave my shoes and coat while I skate? On the floor?Should women skate with their purses on their shoulders?

Opt for a deposit system so people can be responsible and return their keys but geez, how freaking greedy can you get?!?

The skates I got were complete rubbish and probably haven't been sharpened in months, if ever. They were also incredibly stiff and made the experience skating tedious and painful. I couldn't wait to get out of the ring and take them off.. Perhaps that was their intent..... so they can get more suckers to come here and pay for the activity. Our entire adult group felt their skates were bad.

In conclusion, sure being indoors is kind of neat, particularly when it is summer and you want to skate but check your options elsewhere. There are arenas and parks you can try out and they're more cost efficient, have larger skating rings and don't try to ask you for $3 to rent a locker you'll absolutely need to store your things if you want to partake to the activity.
Saw learners on skates and many lining the safe skate

Always beautiful and clean place. And it's surprising considering how many people come through here like, ALL THE TIME. Impressive. Nice selection of mini restaurants (Subway, Lafleurs, etc). Just missing a Tim Horton's of course! The skating rink makes an absolutely gorgeous centerpiece and the lighting is almost always ample.

reviews.text: Good place

Excellent! One of the best deli/grocery establishments in Montreal. Fresh local bread and pastry. Extensive offerings of local and imported cheese.  Full service deli and butcher featuring homemade sausage, ham, smoked fish and poultry. Farm fresh produce. Imported and domestic fancyfoods and condiments. Superior quality, competitive prices.
Meilleur place à Montréal Nord. ...prix et service...

J'adore ce marché, j'y allais souvent lorsque j'habitais le quartier, mais nous y allons encore de temps en temps. Ils ont un excellent choix de fruits, de légumes, de viandes et toute sorte de produits que l’on ne trouve pas ailleurs.

Superbe place pour la viande et les fromages. Pour ce qui est des fruits et légumes, faut être prêt à payer un peu plus cher que dans un supermarché. 

Le personnel est très sympathique.

reviews.text:
Not much of choices and 80% of whats already there is not really good.
Was at "Les Continents " and the difference is enormous. Hope they get better cook or the one that's there should check cooking on YouTube. It Will help a lot.

I used to go here when I was young, but now this place is awesome and have great quality of food... il will go here with my family and friends. I was amazed by the quantity of fod and also by the upgrades they made. It's fabulous
Great food choice. Affordable for a family. it comes about 15$ each Food is fresh.

Хорошее место что бы поесть при ограниченном бюджете. При фиксированной стоимости посещения количесво съеденого определяется исключительно вашим аппетитом. Блюда не особо изысканные, но на всякий вкус. Отличный выбор и хорошее обслуживание.
Алкогольные напитки предлагаются за отдельную плату.
Didn't go recently but still among the best Chinese buffets in Montreal.. Most complete ones not too much downtown...!

reviews.text:
Wide choice of European products , great service , and even better prices.
Very good place to try new foods from Europe.
Great little Russian grocery store, with surprisingly good selection given the size. Be sure to check the expiry date on things such as prepackaged meat and fish - but that applies anywhere
Very good selection of Russian food.

This is a great Russian grocery store, with items also from Poland, Ukraine, Lithuania, Latvia, etc. They have a large selection of imported and locally made items (sausages, meat, fish, pelmeni's,  canned vegetables, mineral water, cakes, candies, zefir, salmon roe, bread, cheese bars, salads, soups, herbal teas, blini,...)

Detailed Russian comment is below
A lot of products are expired and even have fungus, they don't want to refund them

Первый раз, когда я купила каменные зефирки, я промолчала (этот просрок у них еще долго лежал на полках, уже даже надоело развлекаться, каждый раз проверяя, все ли еще он там:)).

22 августа купила у них хлеб «Деревенский» за 5.49 и по приезду домой положила в холодильник, как всегда. Срок годности – до 23 августа. На следующий день, 23 августа достаю хлеб из холодильника – и он весь в плесени. Т.е. 22-го он уже однозначно был с плесенью – просто мы его не открывали, не приглядывались через упаковку. К сожалению, я там бываю редко, но это был единственный русский магазин, в котором я закупалась, т.е. раз в 1,5-2 месяца 50-60 долларов я там оставляла. Специально ради этого я ездить не стала (те же время+бензин выйдут в стоимость хлеба), думая, что когда буду там в следующий раз, тогда и поговорю с ними. Так получилось, что только сегодня я оказалась там и рассказала руководителю историю с хлебом, показав фотографии. Он только ответил, что мне надо было сразу приехать – тогда бы мы поменяли, что хлеб они берут в Эпикюре, и они тут не при чем. В общем, все из серии «моя хата скраю». Ок, мне надо было приехать сразу, в какой-то степени я не права. Но я и не согласна с позицией руководителя магазина, который
1) Продает
    a. просроченный и
    b. испорченный товар
2) При этом не желает идти навстречу клиенту ради каких-то 5.49$, которые бы легко перекрылись парой моих закупов.
Итог: клиента они потеряли, и больше я туда ни ногой. Плюс, если у них еще есть какая-то репутация, то они ее в очередной раз подпортили

reviews.text: Great food court. Very busy and lively and lots of choices. Regarding the stores, I found it really hard to tell where this mall started and the next malls began. In fact, I think we got a bit lost as we wandered around. Lots to see...lots of little shops. I could see how a person might spend an entire day exploring Montreal's underground city.

A big place. Great location directly connected to the metro and part of the underground city. Full of selection. Very easy to get lost though. But nevertheless a good place to hang out and go shopping.

One of the few shopping malls “per-say” in downtown Montreal where you can find almost everything.

And if you are hungry you have several options downstairs in a big food court.

Ideal for tourists as it’s well located and has a tourism info center. You even have WiFi

Nice experience at Montreal’s Eaton Centre. Be prepared to walk through a more narrow design as this mall is made somewhat like a maze. Amazing stretch of stores and when you think for a moment that the mall is tiny, it is not.

Right in the downtown, great location and nice stores around, but the prices are little on the higher sides. Overall it's a great place to shop or even to window-shop. Best part is that it is kind of in the same premise as STM metro (well connected) so even during harsh and cold winters, one really does not need to venture out if commuting by metro.

reviews.text:
Excellent griot!
the pieces were juicy, the salad was superb and everything was on point.
One thing though, is that I found it better when I ate there than when I took to eat elsewhere.
Keep doing what you're doing, because it works !

LIT. Delicious home cooked griot will make you smile all day/evening. The kind of food that brings people together. Good vibes. Amazing dishes. Great prices. Try the Accra. V good. Don't forget the cola champagne.

The main reason why I went to this place is because of the smells that everyday you can sense from the metro exit. The food feels authentic, although I dont have much knowledge to compare, and it's truly delicious. It's hearty food, good for the soul and you'll get leftovers for sure. Their rice and beans, despite being humble and simple, it's a true wonder. I truly can't tell how the do for making it so good. 
Another excellent option for this place if you live in the area is to order ahead for take out

If I had the option, i would give this restaurant 10/5. Very good quality service, food is AMAZINGLY good. Rice and beans cooked to perfection, nothing else to say. If you want premium, grade A, micheline-star quality haitian food, go to Sissi et Paul.
very good, authentic haitian food like my grandma used to make! limited menu but what they do serve is great.

reviews.text: Good place. Nice soups. The peanut chicken is ok but the sauce and rice could be better.
Not the best pho but it's okay... They charge extra for the grill chicken which is a first. I go to pho regularly and that's the only place they charge extra.

Authentic Pho made with heart.  The hard work is placed and best ingredients that can be found are used to compete against the best in town.  There are raw beef and cooked beef options on the menu.  The grilled meats are great!  Don't leave without trying the many favorite special drinks.
The food here is really great but the delivery service..........Sometimes it comes in 40 minutes, sometimes in 2 hours. Definitely needs to improve delivery !!!
Amazing quality and service with prices you cannot beat

reviews.text: Excellent and authentic fare, much better than most other vietnamese joints. Try Nem Cua, Banh Tom and Banh Uot.
Traditional North-Viet cuisine, especially noodle soups (mostly vermicelli)

A really excellent Vietnamese restaurant, paying a lot of attention to the quality of the ingredients, some they import themselves and some unique dishes. Menu very different from "feel, taste and look" all the same you may encounter elsewhere in town. Authentic recipes from the North and...  Banh Coun (Vietnamese meat crepes)  made to order, truly the best in town. Even the Pho is better than elsewhere!
Ok food. Ok service.
Good little asian restaurant with very reasonable prices

reviews.text: A marquee entrance, or at least the looming shadow of the Snowdon theater next door, mark the spot on Decarie past Queen Mary northbound. It's a kosher deli with ample bench seating. A dining area for 50? Food reliably good. Service convivial and responsive. No parking on Decarie until 9am.

Very good eggplant salad and mini danish pastries.

Smoked meat was execrable. Worse than smoked meat from the grocery counter.  Very spongey texture and sliced too thick.Tasted more like corned beef from a can.

The menu has a lot of variety, including some vegetarian options.  The restaurant is very clean, and the staff are friendly.  I love the blintzes and the whitefish salad..  Most dishes are huge portions, so you may end up taking some home.  Or if you're not very hungry, many of the appetizers are generous.
Classic old school deli. Delicious. Closes early though. And be sure to try the fries!
Fresh deli meats, tasty soups and sides, fast and friendly service. Your quintessential family diner with a smoked meat focus - delivered exactly what I expected.

reviews.text: The food is really tasty. I got the deer burger and it was a bit small but very good. I will probably go again and try something new on the menu.  Btw, the dude that made the ceramic mosaic is a mad man; it probably took for ever.
decent little place. nice authentic local feel.
Best lamb burgers in town with awesome crispy fried and home made mayo. I recommended to any Burger fan!
Good lamb-burger! Also, family friendly, with toys and comic books for kids.
Great spot to lunch, good service. I usually go there when I want a good old club sandwich.

reviews.text: If you want a quick bite, then this is the place for you. Fast, cheap, finger-licking delicious! It is a small place, but the family running it is very welcoming. You come in, order food, sit at the bar (or take it to go), and enjoy! On average, it takes 10 min from the moment you walk in to finish eating. I'm a huge fan of their greasy fries and all dressed hot dogs (I take 2!).

Montreal landmark. Not a must-see by any means, but it's legendary heritage among the people of the neighbourhood earn it 5 stars.

Food is decent. Can't go wrong for quick cravings or after a night out.
This family owned place is the place to get a great hot dog and fry in Montreal.  Their hamburgers are real and their fish and chips amazing.  They still make real french fries - not from a freezer.

Decarie Hotdog has famously been called the best hot dogs in Montreal and it is for good reason. They always deliver a perfectly cooked hotdog and french fry that is a must try for any fast food lover!

Tried their hotdogs, burgers, fries and even tried their breakfast. Think plain..then think worse. The ingredients they use -including the oil- are cheap.

I suggest visiting this place when you're super wasted since it's slightly better than eating out of the garbage outside.

There are much better alternatives just up the street including centrale bergham and the usual fast food chains.

reviews.text: Great place fast service, cheap prices! Italian style but not true Italian restaurent. Lunch specials that you cannot go wrong with. For under $20 including tip one can have a good lunch and be out within 45-minutes!
Food was great. The staff was helpful. Great pasta choices and pizzas.

I like the decor and the sitting is good also. You don't feel cramped in terms of atmosphere. I had pasta and it was really good + it is a bring your own wine. On weekend, better make a reservation. Overall, a good dining. I wish they could have a little more choices like risotto but I think it comes and goes in terms of the season or month.
I had the veal with white wine sauce with  penne pasta and it was delicious!
Great place for people with food allergies. Still in love with the lactose free pizza. Can be loud though.

reviews.text: Unfortunately, we had a horrible experience at Casa Cacciatore tonight. I really prefer to write positive reviews, so the fact that I'm writing such a negative one really stands out. It was my birthday tonight, and I asked my husband specifically if we could go to this restaurant because we had a good experience over the Summer. After our meal, I now sadly regret that I made this decision. My main problem was with the service although surprisingly, the food was not on the level of the meal we had last June. Our bigger problem was the waiter was very rude and had "an attitude. " When I asked for suggestions for what to order, he initially offered no help. While I can respect that "everything might be good" on the menu, he made no effort to help and seemed "bored" with my request for help. When my husband asked for suggestions for wine, he practically sneered when  my husband said he'd prefer a wine under 50$. In the end, he did suggest a dish that was good--but too rich for me. I don't fault the restaurant for this; it was just too much for me. Being that it was my birthday, I did decide to send it back and ask for something less rich. The waiter acted put out about this. After dealing with the waiter's attitude the whole night, I finally decided to say to something to the person who appeared to be the owner. Had this conversation gone better, I would not be writing this review. I didn't ask for any discounts or price changes or comps. That was not the point of me saying anything. The only thing I wanted was for my comments to be treated with a minimum level of respect and courtesy. Instead I was told that perhaps this was not the restaurant for me--after all, he had 1000 customers and they couldn't spend too much time on one customer. What to say to that!  At no time did he say he would talk to the waiter or acknowledge that it was a shame we had a bad experience on my birthday. I left extremely upset and disappointed. He did not seem to care that he had lost our business permanently. His attitude seemed to be: whatever, can't be bothered! The irony was that his restaurant was only about 2/3 full--not insignificant for our restaurant, but if I were him, I wouldn't be so quick to offend customers. All this to say--there are so many great Italian restaurants in Montreal. We will be going to any number of them--but not Casa Cacciatore. I have no desire to be disrespected on my birthday, much less any other day of the year.

First visit going with the menu I liked it, second visit a la carte was disappointing. Overpriced frozen small Shrimps ($3 each) to add to your vongole (mini tasteless rubber) spaghetti swimming in sauce. Rip off house wine. Was charged for the whole 3 course menu but only ordered and got the main dish (lamb rack which is fine). Won't be going back for a while.
Exquisite but expensive food. Lunch for 2 came to $60. Cosy hunter's cabin decor.

My buddy was craving some pasta, so we stopped by Casa Cacciatore to have an old school Italian experience. The interior of the restaurant really gives off that old generation feel, with dark oak walls, old photos, various twentieth century guns, etc.

I ordered their ravioli à la crème. It's quite simply ravioli and a cream sauce. No surprises there. If you're a pasta lover and not shy of the carbs and oodles of cream sauce, you'll find yourself in a happy place with this dish. If you're me, and somewhat concerned about health, you'll want to nibble on maybe half of this then throw in the towel, because boy is that ravioli swimming in cream. 
I also had a chance to try my friend's spaghetti, which was fine.

I'd sum up the pasta at Casa as reliably predictable. You're likely not going to be wowed, but you won't be disappointed if you're a pasta fan.
Fantastic food- excellent service- and the best tiramisu I have ever tasted! We will be back.

Best place ever

Nous avions trouvé l'endroit sur Trivago. Franchement un des pires hôtels où nous sommes allés. Ils nous embarrent à l'intérieur pendant la majeure partie de la journée (Wtf?), on se fait battre et fouiller à nue par les employés, la nourriture est médiocre et en très petite quantité, les clients s'échangent de la drogue et toute sortes de substances, etc. C'était tellement horrible que j'ai carrément refusé de payer à la fin. À éviter!!

reviews.text: Great food court. Very busy and lively and lots of choices. Regarding the stores, I found it really hard to tell where this mall started and the next malls began. In fact, I think we got a bit lost as we wandered around. Lots to see...lots of little shops. I could see how a person might spend an entire day exploring Montreal's underground city.

A big place. Great location directly connected to the metro and part of the underground city. Full of selection. Very easy to get lost though. But nevertheless a good place to hang out and go shopping.

One of the few shopping malls “per-say” in downtown Montreal where you can find almost everything.

And if you are hungry you have several options downstairs in a big food court.

Ideal for tourists as it’s well located and has a tourism info center. You even have WiFi

Nice experience at Montreal’s Eaton Centre. Be prepared to walk through a more narrow design as this mall is made somewhat like a maze. Amazing stretch of stores and when you think for a moment that the mall is tiny, it is not.

Right in the downtown, great location and nice stores around, but the prices are little on the higher sides. Overall it's a great place to shop or even to window-shop. Best part is that it is kind of in the same premise as STM metro (well connected) so even during harsh and cold winters, one really does not need to venture out if commuting by metro.

reviews.text: Many shopping options and very clean place. If you need to go in and out this is the perfect mall. With access on all sides it makes it easy to get to anything in 5 minutes. The restaurants are very good and right on the front which is perfect and there is ample parking.
A lot stores closed. But as a local mall. It is OK for a quick shopping trip but if you're looking for more shopping excitement this ain't the place

Centre de Rasoir for knife sharpening today (Saturday)! They can be ready for Wednesday only as the person who does this won't be in until then. I find that delay not so bad, if you're not in a rush of course! I'll post the my assessment of the service after I pick them up & try them. The people serving in the store are pleasant & very helpful 😊
It is always good to lunch at Scores. Staff is friendly and food good. The salad bar is 5/5
Central location. Lots of parking. Well stocked. Good lunch crowd. Business oriented.

reviews.text:
Not wheelchair acessible. 

Can bring in items to trade for store credit or donation. No longer buys clothing. Call ahead of time to get priority. 

Shop is packed but pleasant, you can use your store credit to buy their yummy snacks and drinks as well as clothes!  Wide selection of clothing and vintage items.

One of my favorite places while living there. A 3 story thrift shop with a vintage and homemade vibe. An old building adapted; has a terrace on every floor. Lunch options of a beverage, soup, lunch and dessert for $10. My favorites choco biscuits, samosas and a coffee (for $1 each). Usually grabbed 2 on the go. Superb!

The music upstairs is always WAY too loud. Though I am not a fan of all the confusing  new changes made over the years, its still occasionally a fun place to "treasure hunt". And the food isn't bad, for take out. Maybe I am just getting old.
Fun thrift and costume shop with cafe. Very eclectic. Hang out on the couch on the second floor and watch VHS movies!

Best restaurant in town spiced with an unique extravagant decor and attached to a thrift store. They offer a whole high-quality vegetarian homemade tasty food for just 10$ tax included (main course, soup or salad, dessert & drink). Definitely a hidden jewel of MTL!

reviews.text: A magnificent place for every one including the wheel chairs users. The staff will receive you with a big welcome smile. The facilities are amazingly clean . Enjoy the observation of our city from this wonderful place in the downtown of Montreal

Central skyscraper of Montréal Downtown.  Decent shopping and food court.  Can’t get more central for parking but also one of the most pricey.  $8 parking after 5pm on Thursday and Friday and the weekend; $5 if you buy for at least $10 at one of the shops.  Must see the unusual art display at the outside depicting a conference room.  Also a must is the tower’s summit.  Great restaurant called Les Enfants Terribles.

From the very First minute that PVM opened in the 1960's it defined class culture and openness. Here you will not only find the best boutiques and shops that are are the top of their class but an attitude of welcoming with sophistication.
It is part of Montreal's underground city that links Central Station with Montreal Trust regardless of weather outside.
The Metro, Cinema, Resturants as well as Medical Center are all available within walking distance within the three main regions. PVM, Montreal Trust and Central Station.
Help desk in PVM and Montreal Trust along with various site Maps will help you get where and what you are looking for. 
Happy strolling.

Part of Montreal's "underground city" Place Ville Marie offers an variety of shopping and dining options as well as basic services like a tailor, ATMs and a FedEx store front.  It also gives access to other mall complexes and is located right in the middle of downtown Montreal.
nice place to visit if you're a tourist and want to see part of the underground mall|city

reviews.text:
Came here for an anniversary lunch. 

First, we asked if we could have a table by the window as we saw there were some open seats, the waiter told us no since lunch period was almost over, HOWEVER, 10 minutes later we saw her seating newcomers in the same section.

Second, it took our waiter 20 minutes to come ask us what we wanted. It took us another 40 minutes to get our APPETIZER, in which our pitas were drenched in this veggie butter that tasted like ass.

It took another 40 minutes to get our main dishes. I ordered a dragon wrap, to which it had no taste whatsoever. Literally like cardboard. And again, they served me veggie butter on the side - seriously. 

All in all, for a place rated so highly, we had a terrible experience. To the owners, please consult your staff on service and quality of food.
Not a vegan but liked this place. They had great selections and pretty large portions. Extremely friendly staff. Well managed!
Best vegan restaurant in Montreal by far. Great selection. Reasonable prices. Fast and friendly service. Amazing vegan food. Can’t beat it!

New favorite restaurant. Had the best breakfast here last week, can't wait to try lunch and dinner! Staff were friendly, once our order was in it was a matter of minutes to receive our meal. Rich fair trade coffee with fresh coconut milk, DELECTABLE blubbery pancakes with fresh fruit and English cream. MUST TRY!

Clearly one of the best places for vegan food in the city. Food is fresh and tasty and the variety is great. Their bowl salads are a must try. Waiting staff is always super friendly and the service extremely fast. The restaurant feels a bit like a cafeteria so might not be a good place for a first date but certainly for the dates after ;) there's also a takeout counter with nice options when you're on the go.

MARCHE MADNI.name: MARCHE MADNI
reason: Les oeufs doivent être classés, emballés et leurs contenants marqués conformément aux dispositions de la présente section et des sections 5.2 à 5.4. Un producteur peut toutefois vendre en détail des oeufs non classés à son établissement pourvu que ces oeufs soient propres et qu'ils ne coulent pas.

reviews.text: We've had brunch here many times and it's a very tasty place for both vegetarians and non vegetarians. Tonight we had dinner for the first time and it was really good too. The vegetarian options are somewhat limited if looking for a healthier option, but the grilled vegetable sandwich with a side of lentil salad and couscous was a great choice
On the pricier side but the portions more than make up for it. Great service and even better comfort food. Breakfast at Tiffany's never disappoints!
Fantastic breakfast with some great service. Enjoyed the old school feel and their menu has a great variety as well. Get their specials and put some cheese on the potatoes, you won't regret it.
worst restaurant to go. the restroom smells till the dinning table. very expensive plates for a cheap quality meat.

Can't complaint. Very good portions for your money... breakfasts all day long open early and food is gooooddd! Service pretty decent but sometimes slow in the summer and more if you are outside but always worth it.

reviews.text: A magnificent place for every one including the wheel chairs users. The staff will receive you with a big welcome smile. The facilities are amazingly clean . Enjoy the observation of our city from this wonderful place in the downtown of Montreal

Central skyscraper of Montréal Downtown.  Decent shopping and food court.  Can’t get more central for parking but also one of the most pricey.  $8 parking after 5pm on Thursday and Friday and the weekend; $5 if you buy for at least $10 at one of the shops.  Must see the unusual art display at the outside depicting a conference room.  Also a must is the tower’s summit.  Great restaurant called Les Enfants Terribles.

From the very First minute that PVM opened in the 1960's it defined class culture and openness. Here you will not only find the best boutiques and shops that are are the top of their class but an attitude of welcoming with sophistication.
It is part of Montreal's underground city that links Central Station with Montreal Trust regardless of weather outside.
The Metro, Cinema, Resturants as well as Medical Center are all available within walking distance within the three main regions. PVM, Montreal Trust and Central Station.
Help desk in PVM and Montreal Trust along with various site Maps will help you get where and what you are looking for. 
Happy strolling.

Part of Montreal's "underground city" Place Ville Marie offers an variety of shopping and dining options as well as basic services like a tailor, ATMs and a FedEx store front.  It also gives access to other mall complexes and is located right in the middle of downtown Montreal.
nice place to visit if you're a tourist and want to see part of the underground mall|city

reviews.text: After being a customer for over 20 years with Home and Business telephone, TV and internet service, poor customer service from this office over incorrect billing issues forced me to take my business elsewhere. BCE was unwilling to find an amicable solution even after I hired legal representation and I was forced to take my dispute to the CCTS and Small Claims.

Been a clstumer over 12 years never once was i satisfied. Whether it was replacing a defected cell or trying to decrease monthly bill. Bell just cares not for its costumers. Never have amd probably never will. Just another corporate vampire.

Can't stand this company. I'm pushing people to cancel with them. All my family members canceled so far. Zero customer service and monthly increases without customers knowledge. It's a real shame a company with such great history went down hill and only cares about profits.
Car to go parkings, la source store ,Tim horton,and Nice condition for employé.

With all the respect for Alexander Graham Bell, if I had an option to give bell company a negative stars I would give them -10 stars, Technical department is not upgradrde with the latest technology they end up selling costumer a service which just cuases inconveniences and stress and they charge arm and leg for that and even when you try to escalate the issue management tries to knock you down. 
I feel bad for company like Bell which is just a false advertisement.

reviews.text: This restaurant features excellent value specials Monday to Wednesday. Food and service are good.

reviews.text: If you come during the weekend, expect a lot of wait before getting a seat. But don't expect any smile from the people working on place. The food is good, but I've seen better dim sum in Montreal. Yet, if you order the dinner meal, you're getting A LOT, which is quite nice. For the dim sum side, I don't think we're going to come back, however.
The service is terrible. The food is okay at best. I went there with my family , the food looks like it was microwaved.

The food is good. Genuine dim sum. Busy on weekends. Plenty of parking. Service is efficient. The decor is plain and unappealing, but there are plenty of windows, so you don't notice. When I entered with a service dog, they told me I was not welcome. I explained what a service dog was, and they did not really listen to me, they were just upset to see a dog. Therefor communication with the staff beyond yes and no seems to be a huge effort. The prices were slightly higher then I'm used to (20$ pp) but the food is good, so I didn't mind.
Food is not bad and offers a bit more selection than the other buffets that are remaining.
The food was medicore for the price range, the server coughed up phlegm right in front of customers, and gave us attitude when we didnt tip because of it.

AIKAWA.name: AIKAWA
reason: Tout produit conditionné en vue de la vente doit porter, en caractères indélébiles, très lisibles et apparents, sur le récipient, l'emballage ou l'enveloppe qui le contient les inscriptions nécessaires pour révéler la nature, l'état, la composition, l'utilisation, la quantité exacte, l'origine et toute particularité du produit; les nom et adresse du fabricant, préparateur, conditionneur, emballeur, fournisseur ou distributeur; le lieu de fabrication, préparation ou conditionnement du produit. L'énumération des composants doit figurer par ordre d'importance décroissant. L'indication de poids doit tenir compte de la perte que peut normalement subir le produit après son conditionnement et être exprimée en poids net.

reviews.text: Like dumpster diving, never seen a place with so much rotten fruit and veg. In the Norgate section of St Laurent a poor neighborhood they have extremely predatory pricing. Selling garlic 5 bags for $2.59 or $0.79 each. They do have good pricing on bread, meh.

A no frills general food grocer. Overall an excellent value. Consistency of quality and availability of common fruits and vegetables is spotty. It's my assumption they put out what becomes available to them. However they will deeply discount expiring items. Don't expect to find the same each visit. Cashiers could be more attentive and friendlier (usually gabbing on the phone and generally not giving much attention to the customer, carefully handling your delicate produce or what they are charging you). Customer service it is not. Watch pricing, as they often make mistakes and expect to bag your own groceries. Otherwise, a great value overall.
The prices and service are good. The fruit is usually very ripe here, so plan to eat your purchase in a day or two.

reviews.text: The quintessential Montreal pizza joint. The qualitys always great and the customer service is reflective of the pizza. My friends and I have gone here almost everyday for a year and a half and order from them whenever we have the need. They have never failed to deliver on time and even have given us free drinks on occasion. Undeniably the best pizza in the city.

If you don't know how JUST EAT works - don't operate your business on it.

When a customer calls over an hour after placing an order, don't lie and say the delivery guy is "just around the corner", fess up and say you only just noticed the order.

When the pizza arrives almost 2 hours after it was ordered, cold, tasting more like Chinese than Indian flavour - we don't then expect to be lectured by the deliver girl that we should order direct with the business as opposed to online. We wont be ordering again - by any means.

Worst delivery experience of my life! Delivery guy showed up after an hour with the wrong pizza size and the wrong toppings. Even tried to run with the money before we noticed the pizza was not what we ordered. WARNING! DON'T ORDER FROM THERE!!!
best food we  ordered

TERRIBLE SERVICE 
TOOK 3 hours to deliver and showed up with half the order and no drinks !!! 
DO NOT ORDER FROM THERE !!!
Be warned !!

L'énumération des composants doit figurer par ordre d'importance décroissant. L'indication de poids doit tenir compte de la perte que peut normalement subir le produit après son conditionnement et être exprimée en poids net.

reviews.text:
Dated and half empty.  Needs serious updating, thorough cleaning, and absolutely needs the parking lot repaved (as well as a traffic control setup that prevents people from bypassing neighbourhood roads by using the mall parking lot).

It is also appalling that since the spa moved in the majority of the indoor parking spots are dedicated to the spa valet parking.  Valet parking usually implies someone parks for you, not a guy who takes your car from the curb to the spot next to it.
Not a wide variety of stores yet but it's getting there. I love the inside parking and the elevators located on several directions that makes the mall easy to visit

Kinda old looking, kinda cozy, wish it had 1 affordable and/or friendly looking restaurant for families or youth.
And the elevators at the end of it always break xD
So just a 5-10% aesthetic and practicality work to do.

Winners Homesense, Dollarama and Rubino are their flagship stores. There's a huge medical center and beauty salon on the ground floor. Worth it to walk around and check out the small stores. Not a mall that you would frequent daily unless you lived in the area.

reviews.text:
Arrived Sat at 230pm. It was empty except for us. Unfortunately this was a bad omen. The food arrived hot but the portions were small and the complimentary bread was not fresh in the least. We had to ask for water and refills. Our waitress was more concerned with setting an empty table than serving her customers. My wife ordered rice with her main course but received 3 small potato wedges instead. The waitress forget our appetizer as well. It's really unfortunate because we had high hopes as the closest alternative Georgian restaraunt is in Toronto. The bill came to over 70$ and that did not include alcohol or coffee/dessert.
They really need to work on their customer service and provide better portions.
We came here for the first time. Quality of the food, service and atmosphere were great.  We will for sure be back with the rest of family and highly recommend this beautiful  restaurant.
This place has personality and wonderful, authentic food!  The service was fantastic and my 13 and 12 yr old were treated like gold.  A must!
I've been to few Russian restaurants but Georgia is my favorite. The taste, the ambiance (small place but very cozy), the prices, the service everything is excellent.
Great atmosphere, amazing food and service! Thank you!

reviews.text:
This mall sucks beyond belief. It is not really a shopping or entertainment destination. It's an old age home. The only store with any semblance of life is IGA. At this stage they should just demolish the entire thing.

There's a small movie theater with sticky floors and dirty seats. A pharmacy that is overpriced with horrible service.  A bunch of other random stores with no customers and outdated goods. 

Stay away unless you need an overpriced grocery store with a kosher section.
Highlights are CLSC IGA Pharmaprix Dollarama and an old school cineplex movie theater.

I am not very impressed with this mall. Couture options are just alright, even the food options are just alright. Highlight of the mall would be movie theatre, Pharmaprix and IGA. Overall it is a good place to run weekend errands than mall.
Cute shopping mall for grocery shopping and a few clothing stores. Also has a movies theatre and a food court
Nice clean mall, not main popular chain stores, but you can still find what you need, really good toy store

reviews.text: Many shopping options and very clean place. If you need to go in and out this is the perfect mall. With access on all sides it makes it easy to get to anything in 5 minutes. The restaurants are very good and right on the front which is perfect and there is ample parking.
A lot stores closed. But as a local mall. It is OK for a quick shopping trip but if you're looking for more shopping excitement this ain't the place

Centre de Rasoir for knife sharpening today (Saturday)! They can be ready for Wednesday only as the person who does this won't be in until then. I find that delay not so bad, if you're not in a rush of course! I'll post the my assessment of the service after I pick them up & try them. The people serving in the store are pleasant & very helpful 😊

reviews.text: A magnificent place for every one including the wheel chairs users. The staff will receive you with a big welcome smile. The facilities are amazingly clean . Enjoy the observation of our city from this wonderful place in the downtown of Montreal

Central skyscraper of Montréal Downtown.  Decent shopping and food court.  Can’t get more central for parking but also one of the most pricey.  $8 parking after 5pm on Thursday and Friday and the weekend; $5 if you buy for at least $10 at one of the shops.  Must see the unusual art display at the outside depicting a conference room.  Also a must is the tower’s summit.  Great restaurant called Les Enfants Terribles.

From the very First minute that PVM opened in the 1960's it defined class culture and openness. Here you will not only find the best boutiques and shops that are are the top of their class but an attitude of welcoming with sophistication.
It is part of Montreal's underground city that links Central Station with Montreal Trust regardless of weather outside.
The Metro, Cinema, Resturants as well as Medical Center are all available within walking distance within the three main regions. PVM, Montreal Trust and Central Station.
Help desk in PVM and Montreal Trust along with various site Maps will help you get where and what you are looking for. 
Happy strolling.

Part of Montreal's "underground city" Place Ville Marie offers an variety of shopping and dining options as well as basic services like a tailor, ATMs and a FedEx store front.  It also gives access to other mall complexes and is located right in the middle of downtown Montreal.
nice place to visit if you're a tourist and want to see part of the underground mall|city

reviews.text: Good service.  Very nice ambience... Bad sea fruit risotto.. I ate my risotto, not the strongest I have ever eaten, half way through I ate this really foul tasting mussel.. I did not bring it up because I was half way through my plate tho I stopped eating.   I’m sure perhaps the restaurant would have done something had I brought it up... :( the pizzas look really good tho..

Very tasty pizza, cozy atmosphere and nice ambiance. The food has an almost authentic Italian flavor. However, the menu is very large so I am concerned about the freshness is each meal since it will be impossible to prepare such a large menu (8 pages) every day. Very crowded when I was there so I guess the business is doing great!
Pizza is baked in front of you on the fire! We had salads, soup and pizzas. Everything was fresh and tasteful. Sadly not all the deserts were available. Ok,  for the next time

I went there a couple of time and i always like the place. Food is great and the portions are large. Staff are nice and friendly. The restaurant has a lot of space. Only problem is the parking. Some evening to find a parking might be a challenge.
Owesome place for Italian food, great stuff very friendly, great service, you're going to come back here for more, love it

reviews.text: Service is good but Food quality is poor: dishes are *extremely* salty. Mentioned it to our waitress she replied that the recipe is the same as usual and offered to replace it which I thought it was nice and the right thing to do. However, they should revise their recipe and taste it before serving it. I would not go back

On my night(tonight) I had excellent service. The food quality is very low though. If you are looking for good ramen, go somewhere else. Grocery store instant noodles comes to mind. The egg in it was cooked properly though, I'll give them that. Noodle dinner for two at 50$+ after tax/tip. Not thanks. I only tipped well because my server on this night was good. And I hope he reads this!
Big in Japan always has me leaving full and wanting more, I really enjoy the food there, great location in the heart of the Main. Do not leave without trying their "Sloppy Joe's" it's a must!
Freshest fish I've ever had, the tuna melted in my mouth. The drinks were great. My BF had the ramen and it was very tasty as well.
Don't miss the chicken wings here! It might be the best u ever had in ur foodie life 😊

reviews.text: I mainly go to Dunn's for their smoke meat. Medium fat is the way to go! Their smoke meat combo with fries is very good. Friendly, laid back atmosphere with multiple tv screens. Nice place to go at anytime for a quick snack. Open 24 hours.
Like it has for years, Dunn's deliver great taste and great value. Whether early or late they have the selection of deli choices people live love,  smoke meat, pastas, deserts and beverages.

Very extensive menu, you'll definitely find something to your liking, seating is comfortable, food is always satisfying, the Mexican poutine is the bomb, burgers are pretty good too, I'd like if they gave more spicy mayo when you ask for it, it's very good and the fries are also great, smoked meat is great as you'd expect from Dunn's, all in all, I'd definitely go again and consider it a safe bet
The food is pretty good, especially the smoked meat. It's a little bit pricey for what it is, but still worth checking out.

The service is excellent will come again.
There is no wait for a table.
My wife love the service too.

reviews.text:
I've ordered from Canada Computers for years online before they finally opened some physical stores in Québec. They offer great regular prices and a large enough selection of products in stock. They are specialized in computer components and often offer products that would otherwise only be available online at similar prices, minus the shipping delay.

They also have a store in Laval and their stocks are publicly available on each product pages.

I highly recommend!

Great place for good prices on computer equipment and peripherals. The staff is knowledgeable and willing to help. Items tend to run out quickly, but can be tracked through their website. This is one of two locations in the city. They have items on display, so it helps being able to see the items on display before committing to purchase.
Nice place to pursue possibilities for the next computer build.  Friendly, helpful staff.  Often specials and discounted items.

Can't speak to their in-store service but DEFINITELY DO NOT shop on their online store. My friends and i ordered the same item (SNES Classic) online even though they stated that they do not have it in stock and would notify us when it is made available. The link was removed within an hour which gave us hope that we managed to get our order in on time. We were ok with that and willing to wait. Obviously they withdrew the money immediately and within a couple hours one of my friends got an email stating his order could not be processes. They didnt issue any refund until he called and complained about it a couple weeks later. My order was kept for 3 weeks before i got the same email and once again no refund until I called.
Amazing service! Way better than Amazon, Newegg or Microbytes. This is my favorite spot!

reviews.text: Got a chance to see the kitchen.. disgusting.. cooks smoke inside. Carpet in dining area has mold.
Fav Chinese food, can’t go wrong with their general tao and dumplings in peanut butter sauce... excellent!
Good food. A little heavy on the salt for my taste but very good.

WOW! My dad introduced me to this place, and I got food from here twice within a week. Now, I will first address the location itself- yes, it does look a bit dingy and not the sort of place where you would want to dine in, but I didn't dine in anyway so I can't speak to that any further. Secondly, I can't speak to all the other reviewers on here complaining about delivery, because on both occasions I went to pick up my food, and got a discount for doing so! The food, I must say, is excellent; their chop suey won ton is absolutely amazing, and stuffed with SHRIMP (if you like that sort of thing)! The food (that soup in particular) actually harkens very much to an upper-class Chinese restaurant. Just try it; take the drive over, pick up your own food, bring it home to eat, focus on the food and the food alone, and you'll be a very happy person.

I HAVE BEEN GOING TO THIS PLACE FOR YEARS. HANDS DOWN BEST CANTONESE/SZECHUAN RESTAURANT IN THE WEST ISLAND. ALWAYS FRESH. PROMPT DELIVERY. AND THE FOOD IS GOOD. LIKE BETTER THAN CHINATOWN. BEST HOT AND SOUR SOUP. CHOW MEIN IS CRISPY SOFT. FIVE STARS I DONT EVEN WANT TO TURN OFF CAPS BECAUSE THE LOVE IS REAL. ❤️❤️❤️

reviews.text: I never leave one star reviews. I usually love Boustan but avoid this location. Been there once got food for my employees and we all got food poisoning the next day. Terribly dirty setup. Knew at once that it was a bad idea, should have refused to eat a microwaved meal in a plastic plate. Felt sick all night and today have terrible symptoms. Unacceptable. This location should be shut down immediately. I will certainly report this. Disgusting. If they are handling food this way at the front, I don't want to know what is happening in the back. Not to mention the guy was touching everything with his bare hands to boot.

reviews.text: Excellent selection of Asian groceries.  Lots of fresh fruit/vegetable selection - most are good quality.  Decent prices.  Offers many brands of dried goods and sauces.  Also sells prepared good.  Dislike butcher section - prefer items prepackaged.   Accepts debit/credit card. Long lineups at the cash - gets very frustrating.  Horrible horrible horrible parking lot - lacks spaces.  I still prefer their competitor Hawai grocery store not far from here.

I like PA. I'ts conveniently close . Small and intimate everything is well displayed. All the colorful fruits and veggies are displayed to catch your eye. Prices are reasonable but one should be careful of the specials. Last week's lemons were large and spongy with large pits inside. The pineapple looked nice on the outside but dry without juice on the inside. The staff is friendly and always willing to help. Dito for the management.
Good selection, decent prices. Not very sociable employees but that's okay. The only real complaint I have it that parking can get tough at peak times, go early !

Surprised by the variety of products offered and the prices! It was weird trying to order at the butchery because I didn't feel I could order in French or even English.

The parking is absolutely a mess though since the market share its space with many restaurants.
It's good for cheap fruits and veggies. There's also a good ready-to-eat section. Just keep in mind that this market is all about the price point.

reviews.text: Just had the smoked meat breakfast. What else are you going to have in Montreal?? 2 eggs, home fries, toast, fresh fruit, and of course a large portion of smoked meat, also fresh fruit and bottomless cup of coffee. All for $7.50... Food was great. Fast efficient service, friendly staff. They are open 24hrs. The only downfall is the place is run down. If you can get past the looks the food is great.
It was a very good spot once, but they seems to have lost their consistency. I'm aware that I'm not looking at a 5 stars dining experience, but I know they once were better.

The last time I was at a Belle Province it was great!! It had .50 cent steam dogs and the staff used to be great!! This experience after 8 years was sub par. The girl ringing in the orders had no customer service skills. The cooks displayed decent attitudes! Washrooms were dirty! The fries were not crispy!! However the wrap was good!

Ok..not your 5 star fancy restaurant yet, the food is very good...fries are great. Fast, courteous service (although the person at the cash seemed very uninterested) but the cooks were very friendly. Good portions for price. Smoke meat, club sandwich, gyros and fries were ordered and everything was very good. Again, not the kind of place you would go on a first date or want to spend a wedding anniversary at, but whether to pick up food for a Habs game, stop by for a midnight snack, or just stop in with friends, the food is good so in my experience, very good choice.

Four Star because the prices here are INSANE compared to other Belle Province.

$1.55 a steamy, while in average other places sell them between .75 to $1.15.

Good service and pretty fast at getting your food. Location though is falling apart. Water leaks from time to time. They need to fix this place up. I always take my food to go.

reviews.text: Nice mall. Great stores. There is ample parking all around the mall and there is a movie theatre. It's a great one stop shop for certain days out. Though it is lacking some stores.
Good shopping mall with most of the important basics. Groceries, hardware, and office supplies can be found here. Some good clothing and decor stores as well. Good choice of restaurants and eateries.

A nice little mall near the highway. There are a couple of boutiques, a grocery store, a dollar store and more. Clean place and very spacious. The parking lot is huge and it's close to a bunch of restaurants. Prime location and a great shopping experience.

"Alright" shopping if you just need something quick.

Not really a "shopper's paradise", but it gets the job done.

They have a number of crucial shops for a quick stop, like Dollarama, Bureau en Gros, or RBC, but other than that, it can tend to seem a bit like a wasteland.

There are some small shops that may have some interesting buys, but all of them outwardly appear more like flea markets/bazaars than a coherent shop.

I've never had a particularly bad experience here, but if I have a better option, I will almost certainly choose to go elsewhere.

It's quiet here. If you like that for shopping then it's good spot. It lacks different store choices overall. It's either all liquidation clothing stores or shoe stores. There is a Dollarama, Winners, Bouclair, and Corbeille. No grocery store. Plus two coffee shop kiosks.

reviews.text: One of my new fave restaurants! The waiters and waitresses are super nice! Free refills and great food for a pretty good price and have a wide selection in the salad bar. If anyone goes you have to try their fajitas!! Served sizzling on a hot skillet along with fresh ingredients!! Literally go there when I'm craving a mexican dish because it's that good!!

Wow!! Great restaurant, everything just fresh , the salad is awesome, great wings. And the service is very friendly . Coming back soon. I love it 💕!!! 
so far the best restaurant in the area 👍
Good food and a nice place to go with the family before a movie (Guzzo Lacordaire)
Excellent customer service and very good food and the prices aren't too steep either

Great restaurant, priced well with large portions. Impressive Salad Bar! Some dishes include the salad bar,  try the lunch menu and you won't be disappointed. 
Great food! Huge selection from the salad bar. Waitress was polite. Highly Recommended

reviews.text:
First time have a dinner at this restaurant. All kids and us enjoyed the dishes and the services.  Pekin fry duck & the soup, fry lobster, homemade tofu, etc. 
The servants are kind to the kids, we enjoyed the dishes and the price is very reasonable.

My family and I have been going there for years and we enjoy it every time. They have a wide variety of dishes for every category: seafood, chicken, beef,porc, vegetarian. You're bound to find something for everyone! We've always enjoyed our meals there. The entrees are fantastic. We often order the vegetable dumplings (which come with an addicting peanut butter sauce) and almost always order the hot&sour soup and they're so good!! We also had the corn & crab soup this time and really enjoyed it. Oh, and definitely take the kan shao shrimp. The flavour is delicious!

The prices average around 14$ a plate, but they're meant to be shared. 

The restaurant itself is spacious and they recently cleaned it up so it's quite cozy! The staff is also nice and we always enjoy being greeted by Michael! 

I definitely recommend it if you're looking for a good Chinese restaurant!
Decent food. They cleaned up the place.
Good price, many Chinese cuisines.
Generous servings and decent place

reviews.text: Nice mall. Great stores. There is ample parking all around the mall and there is a movie theatre. It's a great one stop shop for certain days out. Though it is lacking some stores.
Good shopping mall with most of the important basics. Groceries, hardware, and office supplies can be found here. Some good clothing and decor stores as well. Good choice of restaurants and eateries.

A nice little mall near the highway. There are a couple of boutiques, a grocery store, a dollar store and more. Clean place and very spacious. The parking lot is huge and it's close to a bunch of restaurants. Prime location and a great shopping experience.

"Alright" shopping if you just need something quick.

Not really a "shopper's paradise", but it gets the job done.

They have a number of crucial shops for a quick stop, like Dollarama, Bureau en Gros, or RBC, but other than that, it can tend to seem a bit like a wasteland.

There are some small shops that may have some interesting buys, but all of them outwardly appear more like flea markets/bazaars than a coherent shop.

I've never had a particularly bad experience here, but if I have a better option, I will almost certainly choose to go elsewhere.

It's quiet here. If you like that for shopping then it's good spot. It lacks different store choices overall. It's either all liquidation clothing stores or shoe stores. There is a Dollarama, Winners, Bouclair, and Corbeille. No grocery store. Plus two coffee shop kiosks.

reviews.text: What a nice restaurant. Service was excellent and serviced with a beautiful smile. My wife and I had the Table d'hôte. So much choice . I had gnocchi.  Delicious! My wife had mussels. She said that they were very tasty. We will surely return.

What a fantastic restaurant! Very intimate, cozy location. The staff was very friendly and very attentive. The food was delicious, every single thing we ordered was fabulous. The prices where very reasonable too!  We will return for sure!

I thought the food was great, my husband was a little less excited. He thought the meat in his hamburger was oily and not the best quality. My only complaint was when we arrived, we asked if it was open (we didn't see any patrons) and were answered in a snobby way not very welcoming... I almost felt that were forcing ourselves in.

Wonderful atmosphere and staff. Food served with great professionalism from warm staff. Food itself could be a little more adventurous but not bad at all. Their house burger was no more special than the pub down the road... Maybe needs a signature dressing maybe... Something that distinguishes it a bit...  But they do a great all you can eat moule frites...

Started out poorly as there was no waiter up front so we spent 10 min waiting for someone to help us to a seat. But all uphill from there. Sat on terrace and had the table de hote (kangaroo burger and mussels and fries). The mussel and fries were all you can eat and very good. The ambience of the old house is great and then we worked off a little of the calories by walking around near the beautiful old church.

reviews.text: Good quality
Food is ok quality but wait times are ridiculous and counter service is terrible, the cook was really nice and apologized but that didn't make up for things
Extremely disappointed by their shish taouk. It just had no flavors! Their garlic sauce was also sweet, which is just plain wrong.

the restaurant part of belle bleue right next to their bakery.

in here, you'll find typical lebanese fast food in sandwich form (made with their baguette) as well as meal dish. they also expand their menu to offer your typical junk food of burgers, pizza, fries and poutine.

the good? their shawarma of either chicken or beef. their lamb brochettes and merguez are not bad either. garlic potatoes are great but incredibly salty.

the bad? service. definitely service. it gets worse and worse every time i go. worst of all, people cut the line and if you happen to know someone working there or worked there, you're literally being served before people who are before you because you happen to cut the line.

don't bother with poutine nor fries nor burgers or pizza as they pale in comparison with what's out there.

food's good albeit the salty rotisserie chicken skin (a shame and expensive) but the service, ugh..

Very good roasted chicken, good bang for the buck, their sandwich at $4 is well worth it too, way better than Subway.

Mostly take out, "service" slow but for the price and the food, can't complaint
