reviews.text: Maiko Sushi serves up Amazing sushi with friendly service. We went for lunch and it was not a cheap Japanese place, it's a little on the pricey side.  However, the fresh food and fantastic dishes did not disappoint us. On the down side, the restaurant was quite noisy and had problems hearing my guest.  Overall I highly recommend this restaurant and would try to avoid a busy night for the noise level.

Fresh rich-tasting sushis that are almost addictive & that fill you up quickly. The appetizers like the dumplings taste interestingly homemade.The main dishes especially the fish dishes are very flavourful with accents like sprinkled sesame seeds & are well presented. The portions seem small but are adequately filling. A varied wine chart.Their dessert menu should be extended as the desserts are subtly tasty and beautiful to look at but there is not much choice.I would've given them 5 🌟 otherwise. I come here from time to time and always enjoy  my meal ,the classy ambiance and sushi -making in action.. Professional service.

I have always loved going to Maiko Sushi &  today introduced 3 friends as it was our 31st wedding anniversary.  One couple brought us a cake as she has allergies & didn't want to chance getting ill!  The waiter told us there was a $2.00 cake cutting fee (whether we cut it or they did).  Guess I didn't realize he meant $2 per person!  Our daughter came to say hi so we ended up paying $6... One couple paid $4 & our single friend paid $2... $12 to cut a cake.   Shame on them!!!  Left a sour taste in our mouths!  Guess we will be looking for a new Japanese restaurant!!!

I've been here too many times to count, and it's always been a good experience. The food is great, and the staff is cordial and on point. It's affordable and I recommend everything on the menu. It's not necessarily an intimate setting, but it's a good place to go to start a date night.

Good food but very long wait time once ordered. They did offer complimentary entrees which you don't every restaurant do. If you want a quiet place to eat your Sushi, this is not the place. Very crowded but not annoyingly so.

reviews.text: Very nice and friendly place. Prices are a bit lower compared to some other BP in Montreal East. Kind reminder to new visitors - this place is Cash only, but there is ATM inside.

Worst Belle Province restaurant I have ever gone to.
Cahsier did not was hands after handling cash and touched my order of hotdogs WITHOUT gloves.
All employes are extremely arrogant, rude, and all do not feel like working.
I also witnessed the cashier yelling at an elder man and was very aggressive towards him.
Terrible customer service.
Food was disgusting although I cannot complain because I cannot expect much from a fast food restaurant.

reviews.text: They took my reservation, made my way over, paid for parking, walked to the front door only for it to show up boarded up.  You would think that the first place a restaurant would update their info is on Google.
Reasonablly good food that is reasonably priced, but nothing special.

This is a decent rating because of the friendly staff.  My daughter loves to eat pho', so we probably go to viet restaurants once a week (at a minimum).  Having said, this is the first time I didn't get to finish a bowl of pho, especially that the bowl size is not even considered as large.  My wife didn't finish her tom yum soup (thai cuisine) either, mom-in-law didn't eat her  wonton soup and the calamari is just filled with breading.  My daughter was not too excited about the taste either, flavour is missing.  I am a bit disappointed because I was expecting better taste considering the name Saigon and the price point.  The fried rice and satay was ok.

As someone from Southeast Asia, this place serves ok food, more Viet than Thai. The pho is still reasonable but the tom yum and pad thai doesn't taste remotely Thai. Meat serving in the dish is also miserable.
Nice location and delicious food. Cozy seating arrangement.

reviews.text:
(change of ownership some months ago)

review for previous ownership: their bun bo hue was probably the best I had outside of home. was only available on Friday so it was mark on my calendar when I was feeling bun bo hue.

the pho was quite good, almost up to par with the best ones.

mind you, I haven't went in some months and since then, learned that they change owner and chefs so take this with a grain of salt as I have no idea how the current management is. I rarely eat out for vietnamese food
Excellent beef spring rolls. Tonkinoise soup  also amazing. Very good and affordable comfort food.
Food is adequate and cheap but come on! No friendly service whatsoever. No smile! Nothing! Montreal food customer services seriously need some attention 👎☹️

The Vietnamese food here was below par and very westernized with their pho soup bring overly seasoned with cinnamon and their Hu tieu being underseasoned and bland. The food is very obviously catered to an audience unfamiliar with traditional Vietnamese food so I will not hold that against the restaurant however the service was appalling with myself as well as other tables being left unattended while the servers sat and played on their phones. Only the store owner would bring us water, serve us food, or get other tables what they needed such as a bottle opener.

Large menu with endless options. Amazing food at a completely affordable price. Very friendly staff. We purposely ordered more than we could eat just so we could go home with leftovers. Another Montreal local gem. Best wonton soup ever! Also the fried deserts are to die for.

MARCEL LES POMMES (LES VERGERS GIRARD SE.name: MARCEL LES POMMES (LES VERGERS GIRARD SENC)
reason: Le sirop d'érable en petits contenants doit être conforme aux conditions suivantes: a) provenir exclusivement de la sève d'érable ou d'un autre produit de l'érable; b) être propre, sain et comestible; c) être exempt d'odeur ou de goût désagréable ou étranger à l'érable; d) être exempt de goût de bourgeon relié à la présence d'acides aminés; e) être exempt de fermentation et de moisi; f) être exempt de substances organiques visqueuses ou filantes résultant d'une transformation microbiologique; g) avoir une teneur minimale en extraits secs solubles de 66 pourcent à 20ºC mesurée au moyen d'un réfractomètre; h) être d'une catégorie déterminée selon l'annexe 8.A; et i) être de l'une des classes de couleur prescrite au tableau A de l'annexe 8.B.

À compter du 1er janvier 1981, le petit contenant de sirop d'érable d'une capacité supérieure à 60 millilitres, doit porter, sur sa principale surface, en caractères indélébiles, lisibles et apparents conformes à l'annexe 8.C, les inscriptions suivantes: a) la dénomination «sirop d'érable»; b) la désignation de la catégorie précédant, sur la même surface que la dénomination du produit, la désignation de la classe de couleur; c) la désignation de la classe de couleur adjacente à la désignation de la catégorie; d) l'indication exacte de la quantité nette en litres ou, si elle est inférieure à 1 litre, en millilitres; e) l'indication de l'origine; et f) les nom et adresse de l'exploitant d'érablière, du fabricant, préparateur, conditionneur, emballeur, fournisseur ou distributeur. Dans le cas des paragraphes e et f du premier alinéa, les inscriptions requises conformément à cet alinéa peuvent apparaître sur une autre surface que la principale surface.

reviews.text: Abu Elias has good quality Halal meats and grill.  Large variety of choices to choose from with Shish Taouk, Kafta, Grilled Chicken and many more.  Butcher area is very clean and they have a good selection of frozen foods such as Lahmajeen (meat pizza) and Kibbeh.  Pricing is a little higher than some other butcher/grills shops but worth it.

1 star is too much for,this place
I ordered the kebab  sandwich it's raw ! Uncooked and another filet mingnon horrible 
The filet mignon is like u are chewing not on a bubble gum but a stone literally ,
I think they wanted to get  rid of the horrible quality they have and serve it
I couldn't eat the sandwichs  I had to throw it away 
The small plate of potato and rice with few chops of filet mignon is for 10$
These people rip u off with prices! Plus the horrible quality!
No taste no freshness 
The cashier was so mean and had attitude very unprofessional , we called to complain she didn't care said bye and hang up '!
I wonder how these places open and serve people such low quality of food ! ما في رقابة
To all the people who rate this place 1 star or less I totally understand u!
I will never go back and don't recommend to no one !On top of expensive prices and treat customers so bad ! 
never again! Plz have the conscious to serve people food and not rubbish
No cleanliness , staff now wearing the proper gloves etc 
And I found a hair in the sandwich so I throw away all the food
WASTE OF MONEY

1 kilo of bbq kaftah was around 750 grams on the kitchen scale. Chicken as well. Over priced for the quantity and it is never a kilo by any means. 
Quality itself is very good, but does not justify small portions. I had those as take away, I enjoyed the taste while I was pissed of from how small the 2 kilos I bought looked like.

Sells barbecued chicken and beef chunk meat by weight as half a kilo or a whole kilo. Delicious but the claimed weight is less than declared. It seems that they weigh the meat before they put it on the grill and loses a lot of its weight from dripping fat, water, and the like from the heat. With the net weight in mind, they're too pricy.
They have the best Lebanese sandwich in Montreal. I don't buy meat here, but visit often for a sandwich and an ayran.
